result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy Jake Clarin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hard copy of the information is filed with the court - the defendant will file electronically today.
Judge exams the defendant re the waiver of preliminary hearing. The  Court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for further proceedings.

8:32  This also includes 15CM205 Defendant Jeremy Jake Clarin  #165026 in court via telephone with attorney Liesl E. Nelson who is present in the courtroom.   Defendant Jeremy Jake Clarin  #165026 in custody.  William Harold Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The court orders warrants quashed on each case.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  Thorie - Plead to 16CF31  Dismiss 15CM205.  1 yr jail concurrent to the time now serving in the MN prison system. The court reviews the defendants right to be present in the courtroom and appear by telephone for this hearing today.    Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to the charge in 16CF31.  Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of 16CF31 as charged in the information. The court disimsses 15CM205. The court orders - 1 year Pierce Co. jail to be served concurrent with the sentence in the MN case he is now serving. JOC to state Defendant will be premitted to participate in Boot Camp or any other treatment program and the Pierce Co sentence will not interfer with these programs.  $515. costs.  Bond to apply to this .
Plea hearing on September 11, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on September 11, 2017 at 11:15 am.

from Atty Nelson re: Def filed a demand for speedy diposition of an interstate detainer and requests a plea hearing be set and Def appear via phone.
from Defendant re: incarcerated and missed court date. Requesting a speedy disposition and public defender, waive extradition and warrant is holding him back from Teen Challenge.

2:10  Includes 15CM205 Attorney Christopher Bub in court. Jeremy Jake Clarin did not appear.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Thorie requests bench warrant for failure to appear. Court so orders. 2:12
Please see Return on Warrant minutes on 3/7/2016. Court event should have been Return on Warrant/Initial Appearance.

03:07 16CF31 also heard at this time. Defendant Jeremy Jake Clarin in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie:  quash warrants and requests $500 cash bond on 15CM205.  Bub: objects to cash bond and requests signature bond on CM case.  Court orders signature bond reinstated on 15CM205.  Court addresses 16CF31:    Defendant has copy of complaint.   Court reads charges and possible penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Thorie requests $1000 cash bond.  Bub suggests low cash bond or signature bond.  Court orders $300 cash bond on 16CF31.  Defendant waives time requirements to pre-liminary hearing.    Bond conditions read to the Defendant by the Court Commissioner.  Defendant has not been in the armed services.
